plant-info.plant-description: Beets are a root vegetable most commonly deep red or purple. They are a great source of fiber, folate (vitamin B9), manganese, potassium, iron, and vitamin C.

planting-details.water: Regular watering, do not let soil dry out
planting-details.planting-instructions: Sow beet seeds 1/2 inch deep and about 1-2 inches apart. Thin the seedlings to 3-4 inches apart once they are 4-5 inches tall.
planting-details.care-instructions: Keep the soil consistently moist and weed regularly. Apply a layer of mulch to retain moisture and suppress weeds.
planting-details.harvest-instructions: Harvest beets when they are about 1.5-3 inches in diameter. The greens can also be harvested and eaten.
